newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean 3-yr yields close flat, CDs decline.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean 3-yr yields close flat, CDs decline.

text.p: Yields on three-year benchmark corporate bonds finished flat on Friday as most investors remained cautious due to uncertain market prospects, brokers said.
Three-month certificates of deposit (CD) yields dropped on reduced new issues and revived buying sentiment, while overnight call rates stood unchanged.
Spreading labour unrest at major export industries such as automobiles and ship building didn't appear to have an impact on the bond market.
The strikes are in protest at a new labour law which has passed through the parliament on Thursday.
Three-month certificates of deposit (CD) yields fell thanks to reduced new issues and revived buying sentiment, brokers said.
Overnight call rates stood unchanged at 13.5 percent.
